abstract: The business software company reported a 30 percent rise in quarterly profit, but a lower-than-expected increase in new software licenses caused shares to fall in after-hours trading.
snippet: The business software company reported a 30 percent rise in quarterly profit, but a lower-than-expected increase in new software licenses caused shares to fall in after-hours trading.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Oracle, the business software company, reported a 30 percent rise in quarterly profit on Wednesday, but a lower-than-expected increase in sales raised investor concern that a troubled economy could take its toll on technology spending.

headline.main: Oracle Sales Fall Short, but Profit Is Up 30%
headline.print_headline: Oracle Sales Fall Short, But Profit Is Up 30%
